name: Brian Slate
title: Director of Software Engineering
summary: As a seasoned Director of Software Engineering, I've found that failing fast is the cheat code to unlocking creativity. I've turned setbacks into successes, pitfalls into platforms, and mistakes into masterstrokes.
additionalInfo: Fluent in English, conversational in Spanish
Skilled in clear and effective communication
Avid player of artistic RPGs, where storytelling meets visual splendor
Not just a plant dad—my yard is a lush oasis
Enthusiastic collector of fun and funky timepieces
A fan of graphic novels, especially the eerie worlds of Junji Ito
A devotee of sci-fi and fantasy in all forms
My living space is a curated blend of art and simplicity

employment.other-duties: Scrum Master, Engineering Manager, DevOps Engineer, Software Developer
responsibilities: Performed multiple roles including scrum master, engineering manager, software developer, and devops platform engineer.
Built and refined on/off-boarding processes for the team.
Interviewed and onboarded over 10 developers & contractors
Mentored engineers to ramp their career growth.
Converted a monolithic PHP app for scalability.
Automated near 80% of pre-existing manual processes.
Managed a team of 8+ amid changing priorities and staff.
Became highly fluent in devops infrastructure and deployment.

employment.location: Madison, Wisconsin Area / Los Angeles, California, United States (Remote)
responsibilities: Migrated an aging Angular.js SPA to Angular proper using event-driven observable based architecture.
Implemented a cross-team tool for managing iframed applications, empowering multi-faceted development teams to build/deploy autonomously.
Built and maintained the centralized Admin UI portal to provide dynamic configuration for all other services.
Showcased a VR-based Customer Support app to over 2,000 attendees at a conference.
Participated in the transition process during the acquisition of Interactive Intelligence, ensuring a smooth integration of technologies and teams.
Led initial development team as CTO.
Transformed a .NET MVC system into an Ember.js SPA.
Acted as a technical bridge between founders and the development team.

employment.company: University of Wisconsin · Dept. of Medicine
responsibilities: Created a comprehensive HR application using Ruby on Rails & MySQL.
Migrated and developed two departmental websites using Drupal.
Developed a Query Manager tool for research database systems.
Built tools to quickly scaffold applications to meet department needs.

projects.name: Tyler API
projects.status: Migration seems to be going well!
